intro: Dischidia sepikana, commonly known as the Sepik Dischidia, is a climbing or trailing vine belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Papua New Guinea and parts of Indonesia. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. Dischidia sepikana is often grown as a houseplant due to its ability to thrive in low-light conditions and its trailing growth habit.
